qas.question: When did the Dust Bowl begin?
What mistake led to the Dust Bowl?
What states were affected by the Dust Bowl?

answers.text: Kansas, Texas, New Mexico and northwestern Oklahoma

qas.question: How many farmers had to relocate because of the Dust Bowl?
How much did Oklahoma's population decline from 1930 to 1950?

context: During the <a0_0>1930s<a0_0/>, parts of the state began suffering the consequences of <a1_0>poor farming practices<a1_0/>, extended drought and high winds. Known as the Dust Bowl, areas of <a2_0>Kansas, Texas, New Mexico and northwestern Oklahoma<a2_0/> were hampered by long periods of little rainfall and abnormally high temperatures, sending <a3_0>thousands<a3_0/> of farmers into poverty and forcing them to relocate to more fertile areas of the western United States. Over a twenty-year period ending in 1950, the state saw its only historical decline in population, dropping <a4_0>6.9 percent<a4_0/> as impoverished families migrated out of the state after the Dust Bowl.
